edu.iu.dsc.tws.data.memory

Interface MemoryManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractMemoryManager, BufferedMemoryManager, LMDBMemoryManager

    public interface MemoryManager
    base interface for memory managers. Memory managers are responsible of keeping data in memoory for various requirements. The memory manager is also responsible of writing data to disk when the memory does not have enough space

    • Method Detail

      • init

        boolean init()
        Initializes the Memory manager

      • append

        boolean append(int opID,
               java.nio.ByteBuffer key,
               java.nio.ByteBuffer value)
        Appends the given byte buffer to the current value in the store. If the store does not contain the given key append works as a put operation
        Parameters:
        opID - id value of the operation
        key - key to append to
        value - value to be appended
        Returns:
        true if append was performed, false otherwise

      • append

        boolean append(int opID,
               java.lang.String key,
               java.nio.ByteBuffer value)

      • put

        boolean put(int opID,
            java.nio.ByteBuffer key,
            java.nio.ByteBuffer value)
        Stores the give key value pair in the memory manager

      • containsKey

        boolean containsKey(int opID,
                    java.nio.ByteBuffer key)
        checks if the given key is in the memory manager
        Parameters:
        key - key to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the key is present, false otherwise

      • containsKey

                    java.lang.String key)
        checks if the given key is in the memory manager
        Parameters:
        key - key to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the key is present, false otherwise

      • addOperation

        OperationMemoryManager addOperation(int opID,
                                    DataMessageType type)
        Add an memory manager instance for the given operation
        Returns:
        returns the memory manager or null (Null is returned at the base layer)

      • addOperation

        OperationMemoryManager addOperation(int opID,
                                    DataMessageType messageType,
                                    DataMessageType keyType)

      • removeOperation

        boolean removeOperation(int opID)
        Remove an operation from the memory manager. This will result in loss of all the data related to the operation in the memory manager
        Parameters:
        opID - operation id to be removed
        Returns:
        true if the operation was removed, false otherwise

      • flush

        boolean flush(int opID,
              java.nio.ByteBuffer key)
        Flush all the data into the store. This method is needed only if buffering is done at the Memory Manager
        Parameters:
        opID - id of the operation
        key - key to be flushed

      • flush

        boolean flush(int opID,
              java.lang.String key)

      • flush

        boolean flush(int opID)

      • close

        boolean close(int opID,
              java.nio.ByteBuffer key)
        flush and close the given key. After close is performed the key data will only be available in the store. This method is needed only if buffering is done at the Memory Manager
        Parameters:
        opID - id of the operation
        key - key to be closed

      • close

        boolean close(int opID,
              java.lang.String key)
